content.description: This one took a lot of scrubbing, and seems like a new route. Starts in a crystal filled jug around head height, and continues more or less straight up on down pulling crimps over a flat landing.
content.location: Walk east of Jaba (or north of the prow) until you come to a large schist tower. The boulder is downhill and slightly past this formation. Faces west. Found at GPS coordinates 43.8928480, -103.4556053

content.description: This appears to have been cleaned at some point in the past, and definitely deserves more traffic. Starts as low as possible on the prow (the detached block below considered off route) and compresses straight up to an easy top out.
content.location: Best to using the GPS coordinates 43.893106, -103.457355, but this boulder is located about 200-300 yards east of Jaba, and maybe 50 yards downhill. The boulder faces downhill, and is somewhat difficult to identify from above.

content.description: Starts squatting around the corner and left of werewolves of london on a juggy ledge. Make a large move up to an awesome sloper, then move left through more slopers and a mantle. Going right and up the arete is a slightly harder (V5ish) variation. Please let me know if this has been done before, and the name/info will be changed accordingly.

Fairly certain this was a first ascent, based on amount of cleaning required and the state of the landing, but if some steel-ankled badass did this in the 90s it wouldn't be all that surprising. An amazing tall line with an excellent hold selection, and a committing crux pretty high off the deck. Start on the two obvious jugs around head height, and continue straight up then right for a powerful crux move on small chicken heads. A final committing sequence on crystals guards the lip.
content.location: If walking east between Jaba and Scary Trees, the wide gully holding this problem will be on the left about 100 yards or so away from Jaba. The problem itself is found about midway down on the left.

content.description: Not sure if this is the correct name for the area, but there are a handful of cool boulders littering the hillside between the calm gulley and frontside. If someone has more or better information, please add it or let me know and I'll correct it. A few quality problems that deserve more traffic.
